meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into carbon.
meanings.sent1: The wood was slowly carbonizing in the firepit.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the process of carbonizing organic matter.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left my sandwich on the grill, and now it's carbonizing!
meanings.sent4: The old documents were slowly carbonizing in the attic, turning into history.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes were carbonizing the canvas, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To subject to the process of carbonization.
meanings.sent1: The factory was carbonizing coal to produce high-quality graphite.
meanings.sent2: Miners were carbonizing the raw material to extract valuable elements.
meanings.sent3: The chef was carbonizing the sugar to make a caramel sauce.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat was carbonizing the metal, transforming it into a durable alloy.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith was skillfully carbonizing the iron to strengthen the blade.

meanings.definition: To treat or combine with carbon.
meanings.sent1: The engineers were carbonizing the steel to improve its strength.
meanings.sent2: The researchers were carbonizing the fibers to enhance their properties.
meanings.sent3: The baker was carbonizing the dough to give it a unique texture.
meanings.sent4: The artist was carbonizing the paint with charcoal for a special effect.
meanings.sent5: The chemist was carefully carbonizing the compound to create a new material.
